author: craigmcc
msg: Add client-side support for doing file uploads to Struts.  This involved
adding an "enctype" attribute to the <struts:form> tag (so that you can
set it to "multipart/form-data", and a new <struts:file> tag for the file
selector itself.
NOTE:  The Struts controller servlet currently has no concept of how to
deal with multipart/form-data uploads, so you will need to ensure that the
"action" URL of your form goes to a servlet that does know what to do
with it.
Submitted by:	Suggested by Michael Roberts <michael.roberts@softcom.com>
-- and possibly others, to whom I apologize if I don't include you!

author: craigmcc
msg: Enhance the <struts:select> tag to support two new attributes:
* The "multiple" attribute causes the rendered <select> element to include
the "multiple" modifier.  (See below for important information on this.)
* The "size" attribute lets you define how many available options are
displayed.  If not specified, the browser default (typically 1) is used.
NOTE:  JSP custom tags must conform to the syntax requirements of XML, which
does not allow the HTML technique of "attribute minimization" (specifying an
attribute name with no value).  Thus, you must specify a value for the
"multiple" attribute, even though it is not used, like this:
<struts:select name="serverType" multiple="multiple" size="3" ...>
... available options as before ...
</struts:select>
This enhancement is based on a suggestion by Jen Hsien Huang
<u5321007@ncnu.edu.tw>, but is implemented slightly differently than what
was proposed (I made the two attributes independent of each other).

author: craigmcc
msg: Properly implement the public release() method on all tags, to reset
property values back to their defaults.  If you do not do this, you can
run into problems when the JSP page compiler tries to recycle tag
instances.
Among other things, this fixes the problem reported by Jen Hsien Huang, in
a message entitled "Bug of BaseFieldTag.java".

author: craigmcc
msg: Correct bug in the new <struts:multibox> tag, where it was not actually
including the value in the rendered HTML tag.
Submitted by:	Jen Hsien Huang <u5321007@ncnu.edu.tw>

author: craigmcc
msg: Enhance the <struts:link> and <struts:link1> tags to have the option to
specify a link to the page URI included in a global <forward> declaration,
by using the "forward" attribute instead of the "href" attribute.  You
must specify exactly one of these to to define the destination of the
hyperlink.
The existing optional support for adding query parameters (based on
the "name" and "property" attributes) works for both kinds of hyperlinks.
Submitted by:	Frank Nestel (although he suggested a separate tag,
it made more sense to enhance the existing tag functionality.
